Character development: Identifying the needs, traits, goals, and motivations of the main characters to make them relatable and believable to the audience.
Story structure: Sticking to a well-structured narrative, ensuring that the pacing, tone and the character arcs are cohesive and well-balanced.
Dialogue and scriptwriting: Ensuring that the dialogue is coherent, natural, and realistic, with a balance of wit and emotionality.
Plot and storytelling: Ensuring that the plot is engaging, well-structured, and full of unexpected twists and turns to keep the audience entertained and invested.
Budget and production planning: Balancing the movie's budget with the needed visual, audio and location elements that brings the script to life.
